source.7f777e58:
file = '../input/ml-vs-web-dev.csv'
# machine-learning-vs-web-development-google-trends
import pandas as pd
from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_notebook, show
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource
df = pd.read_csv(file, parse_dates=['Week'])
source = ColumnDataSource(df)
plot = figure(x_axis_type="datetime")
legend_ml = 'Machine Learning (Google Trends 2004-2020 USA)'
legend_wd = 'Web Development (Google Trends 2004-2020 USA)'
plot.line(x='Week', y='machine-learning', line_width=1, source=source, color='blue', legend_label=legend_ml)
plot.line(x='Week', y='web-development', line_width=1, source=source, color='red', legend_label=legend_wd)
output_notebook() # show the output in jupyter notebook
show(plot)
source.c31b3ab3:
## Introduction
This Data Visualization explains is very important for me as I transition from Software Egnineer in Web Development to Data Science Machine Learning Engineer.

Source: https://trends.google.com/trends/explore?date=all&geo=US&q=machine%20learning,web%20development
source.2ee0fac2:
## Conclusion
Machine Learning is a growing trend and for some of us it requires to transition not only from JavaScript to Python but also to learn calculus, linear algebra, statistics, and some other new concepts like artificial intelligence, neural networks, etc.
